content: The "Military Voting Protection Act of 2008" requires the collection and delivery of absentee ballots of overseas uniformed services voters by the Secretary of Defense. The Presidential designee establishes procedures for collecting and delivering absentee ballots of absent overseas uniformed services voters in Federal elections. They ensure that ballots are delivered to State election officials before the closing of polls. The Presidential designee establishes procedures for collecting and delivering absentee ballots of absent overseas uniformed services voters in Federal elections. The deadline for ballot collection is specified as noon on the last Friday before a general election or noon on the fourth day before any other election for Federal office. The use of contractors for air transportation is permitted, with contracts including a tracking mechanism requirement. The Presidential designee establishes procedures for collecting and delivering absentee ballots of absent overseas uniformed services voters in Federal elections. Private air transportation providers must implement tracking procedures for ballot progress. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the Presidential designee to carry out these procedures. The Presidential designee is authorized to collect and deliver absentee ballots of absent overseas uniformed services voters in Federal elections. Amendments are made to the Act to specify federal and state responsibilities in this regard. The Presidential designee is authorized to collect and deliver absentee ballots of absent overseas uniformed services voters in Federal elections. Amendments are made to the Act to specify federal and state responsibilities in this regard, including processing and acceptance of absentee ballots for overseas voters starting from the November 2008 general election. SEC. 3 amends the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act to ensure that absent uniformed services voters can cast absentee ballots privately and independently, with the contents remaining secret until tabulation by the State election official.
